skill.name: DevOps & Quality
skill.description: Code quality standards, linting rules, and CI/CD principles.
skill.summary: Code quality standards, linting rules, and CI/CD principles.
skill.author: AbdulSamad94

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance on DevOps best practices. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond reading its own file.

content.value_statement: This skill helps teams establish consistent code quality standards. It provides guidance on linting rules, version control workflows, and CI/CD practices to improve code reliability and maintainability.
actual_capabilities: Enforces ESLint configuration for code quality
Covers testing strategies for unit and E2E tests
limitations: Does not execute linting or testing commands automatically
Does not modify project configuration files
Does not connect to CI/CD services or APIs
Does not manage secrets or credentials

output: 2. Trigger on push to main and pull requests

best_practices: Run linting before every commit to catch issues early
Use semantic commit messages for clear changelog generation
Never commit .env files or secrets to version control
anti_patterns: Skipping lint checks to save time during development
Committing sensitive data like API keys to the repository
Merging code without running build and test steps

faq.question: Which linting tools are supported?
faq.answer: This skill covers ESLint configuration for JavaScript and TypeScript projects with strict type checking enabled.

faq.question: What commit message format should I use?
faq.answer: Use semantic commits with format: type(scope): description. Types include feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, test, and chore.

faq.question: How do I integrate with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Create GitHub Actions workflows that run npm install, npm run lint, and npm run build on every pull request to main branch.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads its own documentation and provides guidance. It does not access files, execute code, or transmit data.

faq.question: Why is my build failing after enabling strict linting?
faq.answer: Strict linting enforces type safety. Fix type errors by adding proper TypeScript types, using noImplicitAny, and resolving all lint warnings.

faq.question: How does this compare to other DevOps skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on code quality and CI/CD fundamentals. It complements deployment-focused skills by establishing quality gates before code reaches production.
